description: Dailymotion is one of the biggest video platforms in the world, and as such, we offer video storage and viewing capability to our users.
steps: Create you application to get apiKey and apiSecret at http://www.dailymotion.com/settings/developer
Use getAccessToken method of the package

blocks.name: getAccessToken
blocks.description: Get access token

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Your API key

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: Your API secret

args.name: redirectUrl
args.info: Your redirect url

args.name: code
args.info: Code provided by dailymotion

blocks.name: refreshAccessToken
blocks.description: Refresh access token

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Your API key

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: Your API secret

args.name: refreshToken
args.info: Refresh token

blocks.name: revokeAccessToken
blocks.description: Revoke access token

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token token

blocks.name: listVideos
blocks.description: Retrieve a list of videos

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token token

args.name: context
args.info: Some resources of the API require that you provide contextual information along with your request in order to return relevant data. This is especially useful when the API cannot retrieve or guess this additional information by itself. Contextual information should only be provided when expressly needed by the resource you are trying to query.

args.name: deviceFilter
args.info: By default, the device is auto-detected based on the user-agent of the API consumer. Valid values are `detect`, `web`, `mobile` and `iptv`. Changing this value will filter out content not allowed on the defined device.

args.name: familyFilter
args.info: By default, the family filter is turned **on**. Setting this parameter to `false` will stop filtering-out explit content from searches and global contexts. You should always check the result's `explicit` field when applicable as some contexts may still return those contents. You should also flag them in your UI to warn the user about the nature of the content.

args.name: localization
args.info: This will affect results language and content selection. Note that changing the localization won't give access to geoblocked content of the corresponding location. The IP address of the API consumer is always used for this kind of restriction. You can use a standard locale like `fr_FR`, `en_US` (or simply `en`, `it`) but you can also provide `detect` to tell the API to detect the most probable locale based on the consumer's location.

args.name: sslAssets
args.info: **Get secured HTTPS URLs for all assets** (URLs, images, videos, etc.). By default, this option is turned **off**.

args.name: thumbnailRatio
args.info: **Change the size ratio for all video thumbnails.** By default, this option is set to `original`. Accepted values are `original`, `widescreen` and `square`.

args.name: fields
args.info: List of fields to return

args.name: 360Degree
args.info: Limit the result set to 360 videos.

args.name: availability
args.info: Limit the result set to available videos.

args.name: channel
args.info: Limit the result set to this channel.

args.name: country
args.info: Limit the result set to this country (declarative).

args.name: createdAfter
args.info: Limit the result set to videos created after this date and time.

args.name: createdBefore
args.info: Limit the result set to videos created before this date and time.

args.name: excludeIds
args.info: List of video ids to exclude from the result set.

args.name: featured
args.info: Limit the result set to featured videos.

args.name: hasGame
args.info: Limit the result set to videos related to a video-game.

args.name: hd
args.info: Limit the result set to high definition videos (vertical resolution greater than or equal to 720p).

args.name: ids
args.info: Limit the result set to this list of video identifiers (works only with xids).

args.name: inHistory
args.info: Limit the result set to videos in your watch history.

args.name: languages
args.info: Limit the result set to this list of languages. Language is declarative and corresponds to the user-declared spoken language of the video. If you wish to retrieve content currated for a specific locale, use the [`localization`]

args.name: list
args.info: Limit the result set to this video list.

args.name: live
args.info: Limit the result set to live streaming videos.

args.name: liveOffair
args.info: Limit the result set to off-air live streaming videos.

args.name: liveOnair
args.info: Limit the result set to on-air live streaming videos.

args.name: liveUpcoming
args.info: Limit the result set to upcoming live streaming videos.

args.name: longerThan
args.info: Limit the results to videos with a duration longer than or equal to the specified number of minutes.

args.name: noLive
args.info: Limit the result set to non-live streaming videos.

args.name: noPremium
args.info: Limit the result set to free video content.

args.name: nogenre
args.info: Limit the result set by excluding this genre.

args.name: owners
args.info: Limit the result set to this list of user identifiers or logins.

args.name: partner
args.info: Limit the result set to partner videos.

args.name: passwordProtected
args.info: Limit the result set to password protected partner videos.

args.name: premium
args.info: Limit the result set to premium SVOD and TVOD video content.

args.name: private
args.info: Limit the result set to private videos.

args.name: search
args.info: Limit the result set to this full text search.

args.name: shorterThan
args.info: Limit the results to videos with a duration shorter than or equal to the specified number of minutes.

args.name: sort
args.info: Change the default result set ordering.

args.name: tags
args.info: Limit the result set to this full text search of video tags.

args.name: ugc
args.info: Limit the result set to user generated video content (no partner content).

args.name: unpublished
args.info: Limit the result set to unpublished videos.

args.name: verified
args.info: Limit the result set to verified partner videos.

args.name: page
args.info: The page number to load

args.name: limit
args.info: Maximum number of items to return

blocks.name: getSingleVideo
blocks.description: Retrieve a video with its identifier

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token token

args.name: videoId
args.info: Unique object identifier (unique among all videos)

args.name: fields
args.info: List of fields to return

blocks.name: addVideo
blocks.description: Create a video

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token token

args.name: url
args.info: URL of this video on Dailymotion. Writing this parameter defines where to download the video source.

args.name: fields
args.info: List of fields to return

args.name: allowEmbed
args.info: True if this video can be embedded outside of Dailymotion.

args.name: allowedInPlaylists
args.info: True if this video can be added to playlists.

args.name: channel
args.info: Limit the result set to this channel.

args.name: country
args.info: Limit the result set to this country (declarative).

args.name: customClassification
args.info: List of customizable values (maximum of 3 values)

args.name: description
args.info: Comprehensive description of this video. Maximumm length is set to 3000 (5000 for partners).

args.name: endTime
args.info: End date and time of this live stream.

args.name: expiryDate
args.info: Date and time after which this video will be made private.

args.name: expiryDateDeletion
args.info: By default, videos are deleted (after a grace period) when their [`expiry_date`](#video-expiry_date-field) is reached. Set this to `false` to disable this behavior.

args.name: explicit
args.info: True if this video is explicit.

args.name: genres
args.info: List of genres of a given video.

args.name: geoblocking
args.info: List of countries where this video is or isn't accessible. A list of country codes (ISO 3166-1 alpha-2) starting with the `deny` or `allow` (default) keyword to define if this is a black or a whitelist, e.g.: both `["allow", "fr", "us", "it"]` and `["fr", "us", "it"]` will allow this video to be accessed in France, US and Italy and deny all other countries. On the other hand, `["deny", "us", "fr"]` will deny access to this video in the US and France and allow it everywhere else. An empty list `[]` or simply `["allow"]` (the default) will revert the behavior to _allow from everywhere_. To set geoblocking on your videos, you have to be a Dailymotion partner.

args.name: geoloc
args.info: Geolocalization for this video. Result is an array with the longitude and latitude using point notation.

args.name: language
args.info: Language of this video. This value is declarative and corresponds to the user-declared spoken language of the video.

args.name: mode
args.info: Stream mode.

args.name: moods
args.info: List of moods of a given video.

args.name: password
args.info: If a video is protected by a password, this field contains the password. When setting a value on this field, the video visibility changes to "password protected". Setting it to NULL removes the password protection: the visibility is changed to "public".

args.name: playerNextVideo
args.info: A unique video picked by the owner, displayed when video's playback ends.

args.name: private
args.info: Limit the result set to private videos.

args.name: publishDate
args.info: Date and time after which this video will be made publicly available

args.name: published
args.info: True if this video is published (may still be waiting for encoding, see the `status` field for more information).

args.name: recordStatus
args.info: Current state of the recording process of this video. - starting: Recording video is going to start - started: Recording video is in progress - stopping: Recording video is going to stop - stopped: Recording video is stopped

args.name: rentalPrice
args.info: Price of renting this video as a float in the current currency or `null` if this video is not behind a paywall.

args.name: soundtrackPopularity
args.info: Soundtrack popularity.

args.name: startTime
args.info: Start date and time of this live stream.

args.name: tags
args.info: Limit the result set to this full text search of video tags.

args.name: thumbnailUrl
args.info: URL of this video's raw thumbnail (full size respecting ratio). Some users have the permission to change this value by providing an URL to a custom thumbnail. Note: for live streams, the thumbnail is automatically generated every 5 mn by default; it is not possible anymore to manually refresh the preview.

args.name: title
args.info: Title of this video.

args.info: By default, the device is auto-detected based on the user-agent of the API consumer. Valid values are `detect`, `web`, `mobile` and `iptv`. Changing this value will filter out content not allowed on the defined device.

args.name: familyFilter
args.info: By default, the family filter is turned **on**. Setting this parameter to `false` will stop filtering-out explit content from searches and global contexts. You should always check the result's `explicit` field when applicable as some contexts may still return those contents. You should also flag them in your UI to warn the user about the nature of the content.

args.name: localization
args.info: This will affect results language and content selection. Note that changing the localization won't give access to geoblocked content of the corresponding location. The IP address of the API consumer is always used for this kind of restriction. You can use a standard locale like `fr_FR`, `en_US` (or simply `en`, `it`) but you can also provide `detect` to tell the API to detect the most probable locale based on the consumer's location.

args.name: sslAssets
args.info: **Get secured HTTPS URLs for all assets** (URLs, images, videos, etc.). By default, this option is turned **off**.

args.name: thumbnailRatio
args.info: **Change the size ratio for all video thumbnails.** By default, this option is set to `original`. Accepted values are `original`, `widescreen` and `square`.
